document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Fashion and Interior Design

960CC8ABD3254A54841319E91EA1DA9B.description: Support the need for state, federal, and international governing agencies to work together more to make the personal service career pathways a more seamless transition.

B93C5325E77349C9B78F6F7847B47822.description: Justify rationale for changes in the personal services career pathway of the beauty industry to keep up with the market trends and needs of the population at-large.

727874701F594ADAB9AEEFC7F3F779A6.description: Evaluate the current rules and regulations of California to propose new ideas or changes to the beauty industry to make it better for the future.

D9331DD95AB8414CA9EFD49A74E4185B.description: Interpret existing laws and regulations to make proposal to state legislative members and state board officials on the scope of practice for the various career fields within the beauty industry.

702E9AC49D3E40B2869962C89AE3379E.description: Describe the current state, federal, and international scope of practice for the various careers in personal services.

5A47F85605114F18BF778B8B48E1D6A8.description: Assess the current state, federal, and international scope of practice, rules, and regulations required of professionals in the beauty industry.

BE4E9A08DD7943949F4DE3647663B240.description: Discriminate reputable distributors, manufacturers, and suppliers from those which are not as professional or reliable with their products/equipment.

9C0C4AC01D384997B8422F222D9EE816.description: Interpret the rules and regulations that govern the personal service career pathways sector to limit your liability on services or treatment plans offered to clients.

FBBD7F43D0464434AFD8F2197C26CFB3.description: Explain the rational used when buying new technology, equipment or products to use in services or treatment plans for clients.

7E22BA922C204BF081E08F30BC8ACB2C.description: Evaluate the various equipment, supplies, products, and distributors, and manufacturers, and that represent the beauty industry.

591C9B53F4764E3783079FF86817B58F.description: Prepare a treatment protocol or client consultation form that is inclusive of helping the client obtain their needs and goals, and eliminating as many challenges for them as possible.

AFAC81D4640A45AB9544687759832E4E.description: Describe training all staff and personnel on the importance of assessing, re-evaluating, and changing the services or treatment plans offered to clients.

3C7EB7645AF846C7BEEC777219A5E520.description: Create a treatment plan for each client individually to achieve their needs and goals of services or treatments being offered.

83A1892631F44B9C84075BC7C0D70DF2.description: Generate professional treatment protocols to ensure the best possible outcomes for clients during services or treatments performed.

BDCAD575394740CA9FB3ADB4D6CFA259.description: Revise or modify treatment protocols for clients as needed based on re-evaluating their needs, goals, or achievements during services or treatment plans offered.

C691B10E90244C34ADC41A22F68A53A2.description: Synthesize the treatment protocols of clients to assess, re-evaluate, and change the services or treatment plans to reach their goals.

F048D45FC7AA4572A4939F3708B9B75F.description: Prepare for all of the possible legal, ethical, and financial responsibilities that exist in the beauty industry in California.

883769A2FBF94FE2AF6BE81B0B706B6E.description: Construct a training manual or protocol on legal, ethical, scope of practice, and financial responsibilities.

2E57B2325D2F4023A597982B88069AA6.description: Comply with all local, state and federal laws, rules, and regulations that affect the beauty industry at all times.

CA8718E5201749CAA0401D7C11FB1692.description: Collect information on the scope of practice from other states to ensure that the industry is staying up on new trends and technology that should be available for trained and licensed professionals to offer their clients in California.

981ECD9CB15846E286D4CEC5EF995214.description: Explain the legal, ethical, scope of practice, and financial responsibilities that exist in the beauty industry.

1F9237AE73594F07B09707C3E27BD651.description: Diagram a service or treatment plan protocol for the client's needs, goals, and challenges to follow at home and with professional services.

86C6D744E2944E46A59D36C870734CB3.description: Illustrate the purpose of having a well-designed client consultation form for services and treatment plans.

F5B5FBFE103B485A9BE2AC3FAC2FC0A6.description: Outline an at-home protocol for clients to use daily to assist in achieving their personal goals in the beauty services or treatment plans performed.

584C776041F040E39C0DBB5AD30583CA.description: Analyze the clients' needs, abilities, purpose, and challenges to obtaining their goals with services and treatment.

1415D00AC5774DF1A3B489BD4DBDDFAE.description: Describe importance of keeping up with new trends, technologies, product development, new equipment, and services for clients.

7F858F1B345F402EA9C30D9DD98E1629.description: Explain the importance of following the federal and state health and safety regulations, Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations, infection control practices for the beauty industry.

12605F6FF3CA42E0A83917B7BB3831A6.description: Identify the reasons why people skills, critical thinking, and soft skills are an important component of being successful in the beauty industry.

F72B35762C044587AB686ADC65DF659D.description: Define the differences between body language, written, oral, and listening communication skills.

669FFB88086748AF89E6C2E414793404.description: Describe the communications skills that are essential to being successful in the beauty industry.

0218D32FBD9F48B39DEC3F130825CC48.description: Recognize the different communication skills that are necessary to be successful in the personal service career pathways of the beauty industry.

ADB7B605A674414895FF2A4B85E785DE.description: Access information regarding the Barbering and Cosmetology Board meetings, agendas, and minutes in California.

20C5CCDE260548388E1F64666CD420ED.description: State the purposes of having a governing or licensing board over the beauty industry in California.

0A6A9E74669243A68ABBD97F607309BB.description: Identify the importance of state board licensing, rules and regulations for the beauty industry.

comments: Students who follow the Personal Services pathway develop the essential concepts, knowledge, principles, and skills to be successful in the career opportunities in this industry. Careers or subjects in this field include barbering, cosmetology, makeup artistry, and manicuring, with the emphasis on client consultation, health/safety, service/treatment protocols, product/equipment knowledge, marketing/promotion, management, and business practices.

comments: The Interior Design pathway is designed to prepare students for careers and/or postsecondary education in this rapidly growing field. Students pursuing this career pathway study the principles and elements of design along with presentation skills. They gain knowledge of materials and products, including but not limited to furnishings, fabrics, fixtures and treatments, sourcing products, space planning, specifications, and interior systems. Students will also be exposed to state-of-the-industry, computer-aided design and the emerging field of sustainability.

3A8AD1F1D56F4CE4A1AFE6A088A3B543.description: Compile textile industry standards that demonstrate sustainable practices.

FDC0DCAFAF3544669B4C0739360FB1BD.description: Evaluate how copyright, trademark, and patent laws affect textile design and production.

9554A7B1E2F34833849B70EB096A81F0.description: Research how technology is used to create various textiles.

AC04C889AA1449D08CD837B1A26D62BD.description: Integrate the skills and procedures necessary to create and produce textile products.

3096A236FB4143F0826C5A81E337956B.description: Analyze principals of standard print design (e.g., abstract and geometric) and color designs (e.g., tone-on-tone, positive/negative, and monotone).

876983B620E248A1B1DD248EA007A687.description: Compare textile manufacturing methods for producing fabrics that are woven, nonwoven, and knit.

37A741E754A7478AA982295C1EF58883.description: Identify general characteristics and maintenance of various fibers, fabrics, and finishes.

008582D708E844808988BFA874B76A2F.description: Understand the characteristics, production, and maintenance of textiles and the use of sustainable practices.

2A0D2AE64B564B1E88A00BC9F5168A0F.description: Create a product describing fashion cycles and the adaptation of historical fashions to current trends.

FF4D97539B8D498382A8F1FE9993C65D.description: Define the ways in which economies, mass production, labor unions, globalization, and technology affect the fashion industry.

BD639A55C5C74351A6C18EA232099FC1.description: Compare how textiles and design have evolved throughout history.

B64328FCFE1D464EBDF2D16B73A2A5FC.description: Analyze how fashion and design have been influenced by politics, society, economics, culture, and aesthetics.

3BD49633BDEC4A3BABE6445C1997DDBC.description: Understand how the history of social, cultural, political, economic, and technological changes influence fashion.

6F907FB6A49B4A82AEF227D4951C6DDE.description: Create a portfolio to showcase design ideas and mastery.

B2FA3CD32BC34FA79B739CCA91E377AF.description: Master skills to create presentation boards.

F58EF884D32D4DB09013DB0655035A0B.description: Integrate various types of technology in the design process.

2F0C0F727E2646B8BD1B4FD56FA3F1BD.description: Explain the fundamentals of trend forecasting.

2070723B67AA4BEE9CB1C711DD034570.description: Apply the elements and principles of design to various tasks within the fashion industry (e.g., textiles design, fashion design, graphic design, visual merchandising).

9B62B0C8EDC846989A52E81B82E1862A.description: Apply the elements and principles of design in various aspects of the fashion industry.

EB22EFEDF27E482982535BB6D2AA7551.description: Use the concepts and principles that lead to a healthy business with a positive company culture to begin creating a business plan.

39DA6384D6BC4CFEA19850B473A0E651.description: Identify and list management titles and the role of each position in the overall operation of the company.

0800C9F26B8948979DBD9F4EB355D7F7.description: Compare and contrast the major outcomes of effective management, such as profitability, productivity, a positive work environment, and client satisfaction.

575F67E64ADB49B29DA7615A1013F07A.description: Practice using common organizational procedures and tools, such as business plans, spreadsheets, recordkeeping, and communication with consumers.

576AA0EB73A7444DB8ED1B9DC3439CB6.description: Describe important management strategies, such as shared responsibilities and negotiation.

E28FA3F27B6E4B61B1259E5F5FC94C38.description: Understand the principles of organizational management, including the roles and responsibilities of management and employees.

564F9A67AAF4497DA11FE060430E2B9A.description: Create a product which assesses the importance of accurate and thorough documentation to various aspects of the industry.

D48E73FC55704945AE5BD94973B8C974.description: Analyze basic operational procedures for all aspects of the industry (e.g., quality control, inventory control, distribution, quick response marketing, production, and accounting).

9FF2608E735E4EA1813CB321CDCBDF68.description: Identify hiring practices within the industry.

05E49F0EFA984600964563B691F61823.description: Identify what constitutes appropriate professional clothing, grooming, and personal hygiene for a variety of professions.

51C6BB5BD02F4223B476BA37560D44F4.description: Understand basic hiring practices, operational policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements in the fashion design, manufacturing, merchandising, and retail industry.

D4FBA73C5BC24ECFAD8FE985E66D464E.description: Research postsecondary education options in the field of fashion design and merchandising.

F401CD4560E54DF3AE17E5F8040EBC18.description: Research various professional organizations such as Fashion Group International (FGI) and National Retail Federation (NRF).

5F9D89DBD9024955A6FC34C3ED958B4E.description: Compare major legislative, economic, and social trends that affect the industry.

C1EBDEAC44CB4378B472318A202AA129.description: Understand how such resources as periodicals, mass media, trend reports, and the Internet are used in the industry.

CFE2116BD4554CA0A3186A70CE09A6DC.description: Identify how the various segments of the industry contribute to local, state, national, and international economies.

3E1CECAA37894CD4BF2F827F5A76DA14.description: Understand the different segments of the fashion industry from textile design to retail sales.

77405D87CA75451C9A1ABE3C641448DB.description: Understand various aspects of the fashion design, manufacturing, merchandising, and retail industry and the industry's role in local, state, national, and global economies.

comments: The Fashion Design and Merchandising pathway focuses on the major aspects of the fashion industry and prepares students for careers and/or postsecondary education in this rapidly growing field. Students pursuing this career pathway have in-depth, hands-on experiences that focus on industry awareness, sustainable practices, elements and principles of design, history of fashion, fashion forecasting, textiles and textile products, product knowledge, apparel merchandising, and garment production.

5228AA8AC3D445C49513D62B42391394.description: Create a portfolio, or similar collection of work, that offers evidence through assessment and evaluation of skills and knowledge competency as contained in the anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators.

271AB50472B141CF860C273289B39C11.description: Employ entrepreneurial practices and behaviors appropriate to Fashion and Interior Design sector opportunities.

B839E8460165479391043B55AC3A8B95.description: Demonstrate entrepreneurship skills and knowledge of self-employment options and innovative ventures.

BAF062586F304D2AAE1DD99544467656.description: Demonstrate proficiency in a career technical pathway that leads to certification, licensure, and/or continued learning at the postsecondary level.

A1D5EB99B453431AA5A66CC13EC4E028.description: Utilize work-based/workplace learning experiences to demonstrate and expand upon knowledge and skills gained during classroom instruction and laboratory practices specific to the Fashion and Interior Design sector program of study.

comments: Demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills contained in the Fashion and Interior Design anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators in classroom, laboratory and workplace settings and through the career technical student organization (such as FHA-HERO, the California Affiliate of FCCLA).

CB154F1A37B0464AA2D3F441F6950708.description: Demonstrate an understanding of how knowledge, skills, attitudes, and behaviors learned in Consumer and Family Studies can be transferred to advanced training and education or careers in the Fashion and Interior Design sector.

1C4C97A307554CD8B807831D5D36B785.description: Assess the factors regarding the individual, the family, and the workplace that influence decisions related to apparel and housing at each stage of the life cycle.

644BB7A7FE344979B3937123B8F9A4FA.description: Explain how individuals apply strategies that enable them to manage personal and work responsibilities to enhance productivity in the workplace.

F684045A1DFD41A38777A224258E9270.description: Assess the principles and factors that influence space planning and interior design, including universal access.

D4B871BF4B4C487EAC300E35CC7C24B8.description: Identify the factors influencing the selection and care of home furnishings, accessories, and equipment.

5BC3B828707147DD9A3926183F8EB7AE.description: Evaluate the factors that influence housing decisions.

DD18B3DDBF2A4F489025D3D4CA527231.description: Analyze the principles of wardrobe planning and maintenance and the factors that influence a person's apparel budget.

F45E6D1AEAB4489B8252A7578159649F.description: Demonstrate how to construct, alter, and repair fashion and interior items and accessories through the use of basic construction techniques and equipment.

0139799FDCC3431CA91D93B9619108AA.description: Explore and experiment with different textile fibers, fabrics, and finishes used for apparel and furnishings.

110F754CCEB5441CA6C7D4168F25738D.description: Compare and contrast the historical and cultural influences on apparel, furnishings, and housing.

C25F2EE4A191491E93DFB78407C58EEC.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the elements and principles of design and color theory as they apply to the selection of apparel, furnishings, and housing.

AFA8B9794B3B44BE86E4FD54A5518403.description: Explore how apparel and interior fashions meet social, physical, and psychological needs of individuals and families.

B3211720BA684FED9D61F92109689238.description: Collaborate with industry experts for specific technical knowledge and skills.

811C876A9AA84A379CE1BDDD39374769.description: Construct projects and products specific to the Fashion and Interior Design sector requirements and expectations.

898F6BEC02314AF9984D8A20C009C9B6.description: Comply with the rules, regulations, and expectations of all aspects of the Fashion and Interior Design sector

5B9E56734C584E8B8F64B5C858B2BE04.description: Interpret and explain terminology and practices specific to the Fashion and Interior Design sector.

comments: Apply essential technical knowledge and skills common to all pathways in the Fashion and Interior Design sector, following procedures when carrying out experiments or performing technical tasks.

CC04C83CDBB74710A85A48C080851827.description: Participate in interactive teamwork to solve real Fashion and Interior Design sector issues and problems.

8DF7ABD181AB437AA6687AE97F2CDCF0.description: Respect individual and cultural differences and recognize the importance of diversity in the workplace.

997251D19D5946ACA291C3BC57A35E81.description: Understand that the modern world is an international community and requires an expanded global view.

C7A59363A1944DDD91CBCB56D4DC6710.description: Explain how professional associations and organizations (such as FHA-HERO) and associated leadership development and competitive career development activities enhance academic preparation, promote career choices, and contribute to employment opportunities.

0453F6CEBC8347FFA0FFF576EF057A29.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in the school, community, and workplace setting.

CF4DFDAD76A04B4AB654883A3E7EA33C.description: Identify the characteristics of successful teams, including leadership, cooperation, collaboration, and effective decision-making skills as applied in groups, teams, and career technical student organization activities.

1671A5B8CBD44AF8B346270902D68028.description: Define leadership and identify the responsibilities, competencies, and behaviors of successful leaders.

comments: Work with peers to promote divergent and creative perspectives, effective leadership, group dynamics, team and individual decision making, benefits of workforce diversity, and conflict resolution as practiced in the career technical student organization (such as FHA-HERO, the California Affiliate of FCCLA).

DEA023E60AC04D35ABE6462EA1605A4F.description: Conform to rules and regulations regarding sharing of confidential information, as determined by Fashion and Interior Design sector laws and practices.

D5DA58841669496C8B41C44BC9D3B71A.description: Adhere to copyright and intellectual property laws and regulations, and use and appropriately cite proprietary information.

0C82467AAC764B49B67FB039BB595053.description: Analyze organizational culture and practices within the workplace environment.

6A23EDC469674166B94C5B551A15644C.description: Explain the importance of personal integrity, confidentiality, and ethical behavior in the workplace.

658D454C37C444E1899BEB35C188B507.description: Demonstrate ethical and legal practices consistent with Fashion and Interior Design sector workplace standards.

84A7D247C53A4152B0629AEE08743C08.description: Identify local, district, state, federal, and international regulatory agencies and nongovernmental entities, as well as laws and regulations, related to the Fashion and Interior Design industry sector.

7A1EBE8318E2437B9F82B8A13D785C2A.description: Access, analyze, and implement quality assurance standards of practice.

comments: Practice professional, ethical, and legal behavior, responding thoughtfully to diverse perspectives and resolving contradictions when possible, consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and organizational norms.

1A02A2D6DA214C16BA637BA2A9AFBAFA.description: Explore issues of global significance and document the impact on the Fashion and Interior Design sector.

5414A237D7854B63B9ED9CF104A45F56.description: Demonstrate the qualities and behaviors that constitute a positive and professional work demeanor, including appropriate attire for the profession.

0975360EED864F44A4F677A9DCE17D00.description: Demonstrate knowledge and practice of responsible financial management.

D0D0CA1173F04D1AB0675824C680E14F.description: Apply high-quality techniques to product or presentation design and development.

A6AF39D6CC1741679DEE471D92335AF8.description: Practice time management and efficiency to fulfill responsibilities.

22BB5DFD25A74E6AA412809AFAC5378A.description: Understand the need to adapt to changing and varied roles and responsibilities.

4443C643CC0D4DC390D06B91397321C4.description: Explain the importance of accountability and responsibility in fulfilling personal, community, and workplace roles.

12452B349D2845A18E55B8F08581FA31.description: Recognize how financial management impacts the economy, workforce, and community.

comments: Initiate, and participate in, a range of collaborations demonstrating behaviors that reflect personal and professional responsibility, flexibility, and respect in the Fashion and Interior Design sector workplace environment and community settings.

35ED42CD46D14084A67C92031393EEB9.description: Be informed of laws/acts pertaining to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).

8B64D81C541B473581E7EBBEFA6BC55A.description: Maintain a safe and healthful working environment.

B9FA8C08A15B4F5AAB8E28A110E8EC86.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

E0BB2F80837A4E43A6F271E56C4CB10E.description: Practice personal safety when lifting, bending, or moving equipment and supplies.

B758A7317F194F1F9750D461EFFBF49C.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

28533DD811D84B70A60D0F36C3FB2526.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

E694B7F8EA65431B914A9E4FE0B8AE49.description: Locate, and adhere to, Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) instructions.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Fashion and Interior Design sector workplace environment.

F5D8170673724FA2ACC7E9FFA47FFC62.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

1811FF5B7FC040C7A2643FE37DBB58A1.description: Use systems thinking to analyze how various components interact with each other to produce outcomes in a complex work environment.

E42282C0638C4B10ADFE55DC8930DB17.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

5CD181EB2CCF4E6E84672D73D688C16A.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short, as well as more sustained, research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Fashion and Interior Design sector using critical and creative thinking, logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

236BAD3CBCCB45D585F5C3B942BD1982.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

95BF2A906CF34DFF8DEF99C6AB29AC71.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

9BFEE113F6C24FDA8AFD91DA58BEF7D3.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

EB1591BC1F664219855969712E041CFC.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

4E629A29C3764654B8CC17D800294003.description: Employ Web-based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

3FA2F9D95A154EF98E09115283B05579.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

comments: Use existing and emerging technology to investigate, research, and produce products and services, including new information, as required in the Fashion and Interior Design sector workplace environment.

1FC8C313AB47425A844AF40B88810DF5.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

4FB9CD325D114E2EAE80731AEAC973E8.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

60B1C4191AE44127AC0D03B1C1570C24.description: Recognize the importance of small business in the California and global economies.

6E442F91FCBA4ADA9FA9E0B1EC0D75D5.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

C36AB8CFE72F48D5AA7A2AE1DC862823.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

1C01F126C3714D1D95E6EB941706DDE7.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

0DDAFD1D035C4E1AB04F206947F09136.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

31BCA9CEC8BF4CEEB473E91AA2213E24.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

AC90EAB88CB9492A8576B2075D7247E9.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

0323C329FE684888B4B01830AB6F5948.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

4C2C1A4D2E3A42BAAB52989B78805888.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

0A60247E456D442B910E5FB789996E42.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

8F243D11A2F344FAAF4128C980980CAC.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

7D72EB2BA3034EC8A4625A6BD09FCBD3.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

F6C5989416C547FF92D081111C05A202.description: Recognize the use of style guides in industry.

C51075F68E2E4145AAE30A98D3EF5564.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a senderreceiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Fashion and Interior Design sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Fashion and Interior Design academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
